docs.title: IT Regulatory Overview
docs.text: The most important federal regulations on Computerized Systems are listed below:

docs.title: 1. FDA CFR > Title 21 > Part 11 Electronic Records & Signatures
docs.text:
The FDA regulatory requirements are seen as the most important laws to comply with.

This link takes you to the full text.

docs.title: 2. EudraLex (EMA) > Volume 4 (GMP) > Annex 11 Computerised Systems
docs.text:
Often mentioned as EU GMP Annex 11.

The full text can be found here, and the entire annex only consists of 5 pages.

docs.title: 3. Other national agencies
docs.text:
Other countries often look towards the FDA and EU requirements, when forming their own sets of requirements.

Some of the other national pharmaceutical regulatory agencies, which companies must adhere to if they wish to operate in these markets, include the Japanese PMDA and the Chinese NMPA.

docs.title: Assessing IT risk based standard URS requirements
Using the Risk Assessment tool for planning validation activities
Determine relevant IT risk controls to test during validation of an IT system after implenting changes
docs.text:
1. Determine which of the listed generic IT URS requirement are likely to be impacted by the change.
  2. From these URS requirements, selected the corresponding IT risk controls, which have been implemented for the current system, and which might be affected by the planned activities.
  3. Use your knowledge of the IT system to formulate the test-steps needed to ensure that these risk controls work as intended.
graph TD
    A([Assess Gross Risk]);
    A--> B{What phase is <br> the project in?};
    B -->|Design <br> phase| D{...};
    B -->|Already Built <br> system| E{Are risks stills present?};
    E -->|No| F([The system is already fully defined <br> and implemented, and there has <br> not been found any need for <br> implementing additional risk controls to <br> mitigate security gaps or potentially <br> failing controls.]);

docs.title: QMS
docs.text: Built on ISO 9001 and includes requirements set by laws and regulations

docs.title: Commands
docs.text:
• mkdocs new [dir-name] - Create a new project.
  • mkdocs serve - Start the live-reloading docs server.
  • mkdocs build - Build the documentation site.
  • mkdocs -h - Print help message and exit.

docs.title: Project layout
docs.text:
mkdocs.yml    # The configuration file.
docs/
    index.md  # The documentation homepage.
    ...       # Other markdown pages, images and other files.

graph LR
  A[Start] --> B{Error?};
  B -->|Yes| C[Hmm...];
  C --> D[Debug];
  D --> B;
  B ---->|No| E[Yay!];
